title: Blackstone’s Online-Shopping Play: 800 Million Square Feet of Warehouses
text:
Blackstone Group Inc. is betting that the rise of online shopping will remain a bright spot in the face of slowing global economic growth. But it isn’t buying retailers. It’s buying warehouses.

The private-equity giant’s real-estate funds have done some of the year’s biggest buyouts, announcing an $18.7 billion purchase of warehouses from Singapore-based GLP in June and signing a deal in September to buy a portfolio of warehouses from Colony Capital Inc. for $5.9 billion. Both price tags included debt.

...
description: Private-equity giant Blackstone has increased its bet on warehouses this year, accumulating facilities that benefit from the boom in online commerce and more rapid shipping times.
